body:
This isn't currently supported, but you can use [raw SQL queries](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/querying/raw-sql) to call the function in SQL yourself.

[Cosmos docs for the function](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/sql/sql-query-regexmatch)

@Marusyk if possible, translating built-in .NET functions is preferred. For example, the PG provider supports regex by translating `Regex.IsMatch(stringValue, "^A+")` ([see docs](https://www.npgsql.org/efcore/mapping/translations.html#string-functions)).

Adding to what @roji said you can also translate some of the options, but throw for the ones not supported by Cosmos.
RegexOptions Modifier
Multiline m
Singleline s
IgnoreCase i
IgnorePatternWhitespace x

rename.from: How to use RegexMatch in EF Core C#

body: Note: we also already translate Regex.IsMatch in SQLite and have tests for it in NorthwindFunctionsQueryTestBase.

issue.title: Cosmos: Add translator for Regex.IsMatch method

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Add translator for Regex.IsMatch method to [REGEXMATCH](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/sql/sql-query-regexmatch)

Fixes #28078

Please review
Thank you in advance
